column4: Hi, i am on LIVE CD ubuntu 10.10. Can i find skype and test it firsthand for video etc , before installing actual ubuntu?
sure look in synaptic for skype
sorry very new
where to find synaptic
it is not at software centre, i mean , does skype along with LIVE CD , so that i can test, rather than installing afresh?
see my second solution, quick  check sudo apt-cache search skype if it shows sudo apt-get isntall skype
sudo apt-cache search skype at command prompt does not throw up anything, so it is confirmed LIVE CD does not have skype preinstalled. now best will be to install as you suggested?
in the default places it gets programs from, called the repositories
video works fine with that kind of .deb?
Thanks, let me try, be here. ;-)
while installing 10.10. i get "No Root File System defined". what to correct?
when tryint to install the root filesystem goes in / so the mount  point will be /
did you put / in as the mount point
that fix you up?
NO
so i am not sure, where i can enter this / as mount point
you cant install to a drive tha tis mounted or you ahve viewed from your cd, right click and unmount it
what is optimum drive space to allocate?
it depends on your drive, 20gig from
how long it should take to install, i am stuck at keyboard layout for almost 1 hr!!!!
